private_information: I can move disks A, B, C, D
I may only move the top disk on any peg
I must respect Tower of Hanoi rules when moving
agent_1.goal: Contribute to achieving the final configuration by providing an ordered list of primitive moves for disks A, B, C, D.

private_information: I can move disks E, F, G
I may only move the top disk on any peg
I must respect Tower of Hanoi rules when moving
agent_2.goal: Contribute to achieving the final configuration by providing an ordered list of primitive moves for disks E, F, G.

private_information: I can move disks H, I, J
I may only move the top disk on any peg
I must respect Tower of Hanoi rules when moving
agent_3.goal: Contribute to achieving the final configuration by providing an ordered list of primitive moves for disks H, I, J.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate the agents' primitive move lists and produce a final PDDL domain and problem targeted for the FastDownwards solver that represents the cooperative Tower of Hanoi plan and the allowed agent actions.

public_information: This is a Tower of Hanoi with three pegs named left, middle, right.
There are 10 disks labeled A through J. A is the smallest, J is the largest.
Initial configuration on left peg from top to bottom is A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J.
The middle and right pegs are initially empty.
Goal configuration: left peg top to bottom E, F, G, H, I, J; middle peg top to bottom B, D; right peg top to bottom A, C.
Standard Tower of Hanoi rules apply: only one disk may be moved at a time, only the top disk of any peg may be moved, and a larger disk may never be placed on top of a smaller disk.
Agents are limited to moving specific subsets of disks as specified in their private information.

primitive_plan.system_prompt: You are agent_1 participating in a cooperative Tower of Hanoi solution. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves as plain text lines in the exact format 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Only include moves for disks you are allowed to move. Do not produce PDDL or any code. Ensure every move obeys Tower of Hanoi rules.
primitive_plan.prompt: Your name is agent_1. Use the public information: {environment->public_information}. Use your private knowledge: {agents->agent_1->private_information}. Your goal: {agents->agent_1->goal}. Think step by step and provide the ordered list of primitive moves that you will execute or request, using only disks A, B, C, D and respecting Tower of Hanoi rules and other agents' responsibilities.

primitive_plan.system_prompt: You are agent_2 participating in a cooperative Tower of Hanoi solution. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves as plain text lines in the exact format 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Only include moves for disks you are allowed to move. Do not produce PDDL or any code. Ensure every move obeys Tower of Hanoi rules.
primitive_plan.prompt: Your name is agent_2. Use the public information: {environment->public_information}. Use your private knowledge: {agents->agent_2->private_information}. Your goal: {agents->agent_2->goal}. Think step by step and provide the ordered list of primitive moves that you will execute or request, using only disks E, F, G and respecting Tower of Hanoi rules and other agents' responsibilities.

primitive_plan.system_prompt: You are agent_3 participating in a cooperative Tower of Hanoi solution. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves as plain text lines in the exact format 'agent_3: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Only include moves for disks you are allowed to move. Do not produce PDDL or any code. Ensure every move obeys Tower of Hanoi rules.
primitive_plan.prompt: Your name is agent_3. Use the public information: {environment->public_information}. Use your private knowledge: {agents->agent_3->private_information}. Your goal: {agents->agent_3->goal}. Think step by step and provide the ordered list of primitive moves that you will execute or request, using only disks H, I, J and respecting Tower of Hanoi rules and other agents' responsibilities.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator for a multi-agent Tower of Hanoi task. Integrate the agents' primitive move sequences and produce a PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownwards solver. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep actions of different agents distinct and represent agent permissions on disk moves in the domain. Resolve naming differences and ensure the PDDL encodes the initial state and goal configuration.
pddl.prompt: You are orchestrator. Here is the global goal: {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Here are the partial primitive plans from the agents. Plan from agent_1: {plan_agent_1}. Plan from agent_2: {plan_agent_2}. Plan from agent_3: {plan_agent_3}. Integrate these inputs, verify they obey Tower of Hanoi rules and agent disk restrictions, and produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that, when solved by FastDownwards, corresponds to a cooperative execution achieving the goal. Keep agent actions distinct by prefixing or annotating actions with the agent name. Enclose domain with <domain></domain> and problem with <problem></problem>.
